page.title: 13A HONING LOCAL CHARACTER
page.content: Mrs. Harvey was born in 1892 in the house where she still lives and where both her parents were born. They died after she was married and she and her husband moved in and her children were born there. She has seen many changes take place in village life and on the land.In her day there were many more families with more children. When she was young,children went to a school at 5 and stayed there until they were 14. There were many more children in the village, therefore the school was well filled. Farmworkers were very poor and the children had to walk miles to school. Everybody, she remembers, used to go to church. There were even enough people to form a choir. Now the congregation numbers about 15. She remains in good health and enjoys life.(The number of such indigenous families is decreasing steadily)
